title: Domain 5.3: Explain the processes associated with third-party risk assessment and management.
content:
🧪 Penetration Testing

Evaluate the security of a vendor’s systems by simulating an attack—helps identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses.

🔍 Right-to-Audit Clause

A provision in contracts allowing you to audit the vendor's systems and processes for compliance and security.

📑 Evidence of Internal Audits

Request documentation of internal audits the vendor has conducted—ensures they meet security standards.

📦 Independent Assessments

Third-party security assessments or certifications (e.g., SOC 2) provide an unbiased evaluation of the vendor’s security posture.

🌐 Supply Chain Analysis

Assess the risk from vendors’ suppliers—understand where data may flow and if there are potential vulnerabilities in the chain.

📜 Agreement Types

📈 Service-Level Agreement (SLA)

Defines the level of service a vendor will provide, including uptime, response time, and performance metrics.

📝 Memorandum of Agreement (MOA)

A formal document outlining the terms and scope of the relationship between two parties.

🤝 Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)

Similar to an MOA, but typically non-legally binding—used to outline shared objectives.

🔄 Master Service Agreement (MSA)

A broad agreement that sets out the terms and conditions for all future contracts between two parties.

📋 Work Order (WO) / Statement of Work (SOW)

Specific project-based agreements detailing deliverables, timelines, and costs.

🔒 Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)

Legally binding contract where the vendor agrees to keep sensitive information confidential.

💼 Business Partners Agreement (BPA)

Formalizes the terms and conditions of a partnership, including roles, responsibilities, and revenue sharing.

🔍 Vendor Monitoring

🧪 Questionnaires

Use detailed questionnaires to assess vendor’s security practices, policies, and compliance with your requirements.

📊 Rules of Engagement

Set the expectations and boundaries for vendors, especially when it comes to assessing their systems or accessing sensitive data.
